author: Karthik Madhavan
text:
‘BJP, AIADMK and DMK trying to claim credit for lifting ban’

The BJP-led Central Government has lifted the ban on Jallikattu and other bull sports with an eye on the ensuing Tamil Nadu Assembly election, Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI-M) State Secretary G. Ramakrishnan said here on Saturday.

Addressing journalists in the presence of former Member of Parliament P.R. Natarajan and District Secretary V. Ramamoorthy, he said the BJP, AIADMK and DMK trying to claim credit for the lifting of ban ahead of election.

These parties did very little in 2015 when jallikattu and rekla were not held during Pongal. Now that the government had lifted the ban, it should follow it up with a bill in the ensuing budget session of Parliament.

CM candidate

The People’s Welfare Front (PWF) would announce its chief ministerial candidate only after the polls as the constituent parties had come to an understanding on the subject, said Mr. Ramakrishnan.

At present the alliance was focussed on reaching the voters through its common minimum programme, which offered the people an alternative to the policies and programmes pursued by the AIADMK and DMK.

The two parties were responsible for the Chennai floods, the deterioration in political culture in the State and scams that had taken place in the last 30 years in the State.

‘Government should introduce a bill in the ensuing budget session of Parliament’
title: Jallikattu decision with eye on elections, says CPI (M)
